{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492356,"name":"Ricky","username":"Fafa","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fafa/{size}/217310_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T15:58:17.290Z","cooked":"

A lot of my team’s library code that used MotorController as a generic solution for motor controllers no longer works because it seems like TalonFX motors no longer extend MotorController, which causes a lot of the code that utilizes it to give errors. Does anybody know a new alternative? Thanks.

image791×145 11.3 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-25T15:58:17.290Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":165,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":868.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483534,"topic_slug":"new-generic-solution-for-motor-controllers","display_username":"Ricky","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64590,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5587 Programming Lead"},"post_url":"/t/new-generic-solution-for-motor-controllers/483534/1","custom_user_title":"5587 Programming Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3492362,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T16:03:09.602Z","cooked":"

There has been a bit of discussion on this. The MotorController class was built with PWM Motor controllers in mind and for a while CAN motor controllers implemented it. But it really didn’t match optimal configuration methods for CAN so it was phased out.

There will be a new one when someone gets around to writing it (that someone might be me)

For now I’ve just made two versions for the class - one that uses MotorController for all motors other than Talon motors and another one that’s just for Talon motors. It’s an annoying solution but it works.

I’m curious how your old class worked? Did you just send percent/voltage to the motor controller, and handled all sensors and PID and such on the roboRIO? Or did you make something complicated to handle all the varied ways to do things on different motor controllers.

Relatively sure it’s just the first thing you mentioned, one of the older members on my team who graduated wrote the original code. It’s public on GitHub, so you can take a look if you want to see how we did it.
